SourceText: When you are angry, you might feel like your heart is beating fast, you have racing thoughts in your head, your muscles are tense, or your face is feeling hot. You may feel like shouting, saying mean things, punishing, hitting, or breaking things.

SourceText: However, it is important to learn how to control your anger so that it does not result in someone getting hurt.

SourceText: Try to see what is making you angry. Take a pause or a few deep breaths, and ask yourself, â€œWhy is this situation bothering me so much?â€If you think you can not control your anger and may hurt someone, STOP and walk away from the situation. Allow yourself to calm down before responding. Remember to be kind to yourself and remind yourself that you can handle your emotions and anger without hurting anyone else.

SourceText: If you need to manage your anger before you respond, you can always begin by taking a pause or a few deep breaths. If you are feeling more angry, you can distract yourself from some other tasks till the feeling passes away. For example, watching a funny or comforting video. If you are feeling very angry, doing something active helps you release your emotions. You can do some quick exercise, scream into a pillow in a private space, or talk to a loved one. You may need to try the strategy more than once until you feel less angry.
text: Si necesitas disminuir tu enojo antes de responder, siempre puedes empezar por hacer una pausa o respirar profundamente unas cuantas veces. Si el enojo sigue escalando, puedes distraerte con otras actividades hasta que se te pase el sentimiento. Puedes hacer algÃºn ejercicio rÃ¡pido, gritar contra una almohada en un espacio privado o hablar con un ser querido. Puede que necesites probar estas estrategias mÃ¡s de una vez hasta que se vaya disminuyendo la intensidad del enojo.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is the only caregiver for her two grandchildren. Household duties, getting older, and having little money often make her feel overwhelmed and un-supported. SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ **NOTICE** What are you feeling in your body? When stressed most of the time, you can experience headaches, tiredness, or difficulty sleeping. Check in on your emotions. Stress can make you feel irritable, snap at loved ones, or want to be alone.Take a moment to notice your thoughts. Stress can fill your head with racing, worrying, and negative thoughts.
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ **IDENTIFICAR** Â¿QuÃ© sientes en tu cuerpo? La mayorÃ­a de las veces, cuando tienes estrÃ©s, puedes experimentar dolores de cabeza, cansancio o dificultad para dormir. Debes estar consciente de tus emociones. El estrÃ©s puede hacer que sientas irritaciÃ³n, que te molestes con tus seres queridos o que quieras estar en soledad.TÃ³mate un momento para prestarle atenciÃ³n a tus pensamientos. El estrÃ©s puede llenarte la cabeza de pensamientos muy acelerados, alarmantes y negativos.

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£**BE KIND** ğŸ’š When you begin feeling stressed, pause or take a few breaths.
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ **SER AMABLE** ğŸ’š Cuando empieces a sentir estrÃ©s, haz una pausa o respira un poco.

SourceText: â¸ Try to get enough sleep every night - at least 7 or 8 hours if possible.ğŸ Eat healthy foods as much as possible and maintain a balanced diet.

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ **RECHARGE** Take breaks during the day to recharge your energy. Small breaks can help, bit by bit.
